    • DAG_Impl

      public DAG_Impl(Random random)
      Constructor for the DAG_Impl class. Initializes an instance of the directed acyclic graph with a provided random number generator.
      Parameters:
      random - a Random instance used for probabilistic or randomized operations.

    • DAG_Impl

      public DAG_Impl()
      Default constructor for the DAG_Impl class. This constructor initializes an instance of the directed acyclic graph using a new instance of Random. It serves as a convenience constructor to create a DAG_Impl without providing a specific random number generator.

  • Method Details

    • dfs

      public void dfs(V vertex, Consumer<V> pre, Consumer<V> post)
      Executes a depth-first search (DFS) on the graph starting from the specified vertex. The method visits vertices in a depth-first manner, while applying the provided pre-consumer and post-consumer functions at different stages of the traversal.
      Specified by:
      dfs in interface DAG<V,E>
      Parameters:
      vertex - the starting vertex for the DFS traversal.
      pre - a consumer function that is executed on each vertex before recursively calling DFS for its neighbors.
      post - a consumer function that is executed on each vertex after all its neighbors have been visited.

    • sorted

      public Iterable<V> sorted()
      Returns the vertices of the directed acyclic graph (DAG) in a topologically sorted order. The method utilizes a depth-first search (DFS) approach to compute the reverse postorder of the graph.
      Specified by:
      sorted in interface DAG<V,E>
      Returns:
      an Iterable containing the vertices of the graph in topological order.

    • edges

      public SizedIterable<Edge<V,E>> edges()
      Retrieves all the edges of the directed acyclic graph (DAG). This method iterates through all adjacency lists and collects all edges into a single collection.
      Specified by:
      edges in interface DAG<V,E>
      Overrides:
      edges in class DiGraph<V,E>
      Returns:
      a SizedIterable containing all the edges of the graph.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(Edge<V,E> edge)
      Adds a directed edge to the graph by updating the adjacency list for the source vertex and ensuring the adjacency structure exists for the destination vertex.
      Overrides:
      addEdge in class DiGraph<V,E>
      Parameters:

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(V from, V to, E attributes)
      Adds a directed edge to the graph from a source vertex to a destination vertex, with associated attributes.
      Parameters:
      from - the source vertex of the edge.
      to - the destination vertex of the edge.
      attributes - the attributes associated with the edge.

    • getAdjacencyBag

      protected Bag<Edge<V,E>> getAdjacencyBag(V vertex)
      Retrieves or initializes the adjacency bag for a given vertex in the graph. An adjacency bag contains all the edges that originate from the specified vertex. If the adjacency bag for the vertex does not exist, it is created and stored.
      Overrides:
      getAdjacencyBag in class AbstractGraph<V,Edge<V,E>>
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex for which the adjacency bag is requested.
      Returns:
      the Bag of edges adjacent to the given vertex.
